meanings.definition: A device that produces a loud, wailing sound as a warning or signal.
meanings.sent1: The sirens on the ambulance alerted everyone to move out of the way.
meanings.sent2: The police car's sirens blared as it rushed to the scene of the accident.
meanings.sent3: The loud sirens startled the cat, making it jump off the fence.
meanings.sent4: The sirens of the fire truck pierced through the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The sirens of the tornado warning system echoed across the town, urging people to seek shelter.

meanings.definition: Mythological creatures, typically depicted as women with bird-like features, whose singing lures sailors to their doom.
meanings.sent1: In the ancient tales, sailors were warned of the sirens' enchanting songs.
meanings.sent2: The sailors were mesmerized by the sirens' haunting melodies.
meanings.sent3: The sirens' beautiful voices were so captivating that even the seagulls stopped to listen.
meanings.sent4: The sirens' songs were said to be more alluring than any treasure at sea.
meanings.sent5: The sailors plugged their ears to resist the sirens' fatal calls, knowing the danger they posed.

meanings.definition: Women who are considered to be alluring or seductive.
meanings.sent1: The actress was known as one of the sirens of Hollywood, captivating audiences with her beauty.
meanings.sent2: She walked into the room with the grace and allure of a siren, turning heads wherever she went.
meanings.sent3: The siren at the party had a magnetic charm that drew everyone to her side.
meanings.sent4: Her siren-like presence made even the most composed men stumble over their words.
meanings.sent5: She had a siren's ability to enchant with just a smile, leaving a trail of admirers in her wake.
